text: Psalm 82
God Commands Justice
A psalm of Asaph.\f + \fr Ps 82 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
God stands in the divine assembly;\f + \fr 82:1 \ft Or “assembly of \fqa El \ft ” \f*
he administers judgment in the midst of \add the\add* gods.\f + \fr 82:1 \ft Hebrew \fqa elohim \ft  \f*
“How long will you judge unjustly
and ⸤show favoritism to the wicked⸥?\f + \fr 82:2 \ft Literally “lift up the faces of the wicked” \f* \qs Selah\qs*
Judge \add on behalf of the\add* helpless and \add the\add* orphan;
provide justice \add to the\add* afflicted and \add the\add* poor.
Rescue \add the\add* helpless and \add the\add* needy;
deliver \add them\add* from the hand of \add the\add* wicked.”
They do not know or consider.\f + \fr 82:5 \ft Or “understand” \f*
They go about in the darkness,
\add so that\add* all \add the\add* foundations of \add the\add* earth are shaken.
I have said,\f + \fr 82:6 \ft Hebrew “I, I have said” \f* “You \add are\add* gods,
and sons of the Most High, all of you.
However, you will die like men,\f + \fr 82:7 \ft Singular \f*
and you will fall like one of the princes.”
Rise up, O God, judge the earth,
because you shall inherit\f + \fr 82:8 \ft Or “receive an inheritance” \f* all the nations.
